Mazda looks like he was already turning before dc got to the parked car, in that case, if Mazda's already more OUT than he is IN, then it becomes a case of oncoming traffic

In which case, DC needs to give way to the Mazda because the parked car is on his side.

After he's let the Mazda cross, he can go and ram into the braindead tard that parked the car there, but only after giving way to the Mazda (oncoming traffic in its own lane)

as someone whose friend has owned a megane and I myself a peugeot,  
The french reputation definitely checks out, there are a few exceptions where the cars don't croak

High school in my pants

As a person, I have to save Ai
she got done so dirty

Everyone else was pretty much a warrior or fighter and died as a result of such. 

She was just a normal person struggling emotionally and mentally. She barely got to tell her kids she loved them and hers was completely uncalled for. Died for the pettiest reason: Simp Jealousy

Then probably Koro sensei, he abandoned the warrior/assassins way of life and was just teaching kids. He could've had a normal life if it hadn't been forcefully taken from him by those experiments.
The subreddit mods

Between Eren,  Light and Johan imo

everyone else is kinda just pure evil that did horrendous things with malicious intent

I might give this to Eren

Light could redeem himself, since he originally just started out wanting to kill criminals

Johan realized himself a monster and literally tried to get himself taken out by tenma, he loved Anna/Nina too, so there was definitely a human side of him in there

So Johan's definitely my second pick

Eren was originally just planning to eradicate titans but then he learned a calamity would kill like 80% of the population including those close to him

So to prevent it he just became the calamity itself to try and make sure that his close ones weren't included in that 80%. He definitely lost himself in the power, but he was a man with good intentions who did the wrong thing. Still a villain, but not maniacally evil like everyone else on the list

honestly I'm not justice-driven or anything,

TL;DR  I don't pirate most indie games Cuz i'd feel guilty and think they deserve the money from each purchase for their effort and genuine passion. 

I DO pirate from corpos, but not because i don't think they deserve money or because i "want to fight against corpo greed" but mainly just because most corpos overprice games nowadays and I ain't paying $90 for a game just as good as $40 games a while back, except it's got better graphics. If you're gonna charge me more than double the price just for better graphics, I'm gonna pirate

Episode 2 was still from a cinematic perspective the best episode of the series
Episode 1 got me interested and episode 2 got me hooked harder than a fish on a line

Music, voice acting, pacing, camera angles, effects. Themes, Emotion, Character Psychological Exploration, Symbolism, Parallels, foreshadowing. People usually say solo leveling is a pretty mid atory and while i can understand that narratively sometimes, EPISODE 2 was an actual masterclass the damn exception
balls

this guy really said "no fight choreography" to one of the overall best choreographed anime in recent years

The rays of light were only like 2 shots and even those were done extremely well with other elements alongside to support them

The hand to hand after beru powers up is choreography on the level of jjk or (the first episodes) of Ninja kamui

Baran fight was PURE choreography, almost no flashy easy-ways-out. But the best choreography and cinematography was Jinwoo vs Igris. 

So much Delusion from people that haven't done a day of animating in their lives. People that equate flashy effects to good animation might be stupid, but people that don't think that complex ANIMATED choreography counts as animation are even more stupid

Alright bringing out the 🤓 here lol

Shadows even out the numbers a fair bit
current Jinwoo alone is slightly above current sukuna
Assuming he's allowed to Arise the ppl he kills in the JJK verse, that would mean the battle eventually dwindles down to jinwoo's army and the rest of the jjk cast vs Sukuna and Gojo
Current sukuna gets clapped if they all gang up on him or even in a 1v1 if jinwoo uses abilities

Ruler's hand can crush/decapitate Gojo without anything actually making contact especially since it doesn't use mana. Infinite void wouldn't affect someone immune to poison, afflictions, curses, mental attacks

Murderous intent would cut both their power in half since neither are EXTREMELY more powerful than him
15f sukuna down to 7ish finger sukuna, easy wipe
Gojo although his infinity would be unaffected, his strength, speed, cursed energy, would all be cut in half

Mahoraga could be a problem, jinwoo's definitely smart enough to notice he's evolving and finish him off with Tusks sphere of avarice powered nuke, maybe add baran's lightning attack from his sword in there (since he has that now)

also

Igris, Tusk and Kaisel are all S Rank shadows
S rank battles have led to cities destroyed as collateral
and he's got THREE


Malevolent Shrine at half his current power would simply be ineffective

Jinwoo's base speed overwhelmed yoonho who's arguably the fastest S rank

With dash, he's blitzing sukuna in MS as soon as he shows up

Really loved Ryousuke as a character
when he first showed up you'd think he was a stuck up guy with skill. 
Turns out, not only was he a respectable nice and likeable guy, but he was a character of his own. Not a "filler character". His backstory with Kaori and everything was one of my favorite races in the series. 

And i love how Kaori was the reason the initial "D" came to be. Because she urged him to follow his dream. Which was the exact reason he ended up eventually making Project D and coaching Takumi to greatness.

challenging, but alas nowhere near as immersive, it FEELS like you're playing a game when you play battle talent. BnS at least has mods to Make the A.I. harder in nomad, but the pc version  1.0 (soon coming to nomad) is going to OFFICIALLY make the NPCs even better, and overlay mods on TOP of that, and battle talent is NOT coming close my man.

But I will admit battle talent until recently had a much better campaign and overall gameplay experience considering the length of the campaign mode and content. Less repetitive.

yeah nah, this was the only thing. And not only did she not having anything to do with the main cast, we already know from ep 1 how fast celebrity deaths are forgotten. It happened with Ai, but never with Gorou or Yura cuz their bodies were never found. They were considered missing, but actors have gone MiA to just escape their lives all the time. Plus she was on vacation, so she could easily just be slacking off

PLUS he made it look like an accident so even if it HAD become common knowledge, it DEFINITELY wouldn't have been a point of discussion for long, considering Ai's murder was forgotten in no time too. And that was a MURDER.
